intro: Pedicularis opsiantha, commonly known as the alpine lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
